details:
Subject :-	Deputation of Officers for the posts of Director (Rs.14300-400-18300/-) at NIFT Centres, Kannur, Shillong, Bhopal and Patna.

	National Institute of Fashion Technology [NIFT], a premier Institute for imparting Fashion Business Education was set up by Ministry of Textiles with its eight Centres located at New Delhi, Mumbai, Kolkata, Chennai, Huderabad, Gandhinagar, Bangalore & Rae Bareli.  The Institute has been conferred statutory status by NFFT Act, 2006, for promotion and development of education and research in Fashion Technology leading to Graduate and Post Graduate degrees, Doctoral and Post Doctoral Courses.
2.	Four new NIFT Centres at Kannur, Shillong, Bhopal and Patna are proposed to be opened shortly and NIFT is in the process of recruitment of Directors for these new Centres.  The posts are required to be filled on deputation from Officers of All India Services, Other Central Services and State Civil Services, in the grade of Deputation Secretary/Director.
	Eligible and interested officers [1993-1995 Batch] are requested to apply urgently and to contact Under Secretary, General Administration Department, Mantralaya, Mumbai immediately. (Tel.No.022-22874955 or 22793205) for further details.

   Sd/-
 Under Secretary to the
Government of Maharashtra
title: Deputation of Officers for the posts of Director (Rs.14300-400-18300/-) at NIFT Centres, Kannur, Shillong, Bhopal and Patna

S.  No.	Training Course	Period	Eligibility	Last date of submission of application of DoPT
1	Flood related disaster Mitigation	30.09.2007 to 19.09.2008	* 3 years experience in field of flood management * Not below 22 years and above 40 years of age	29.06.2007

4	Empowerment and Rural Women.	27.08.2007 to 10.11.2007	--	29.06.2007
5	Immigration Control Administration (Asian countries)	01.10.2007 to 01.11.2007	--	20.07.2007

If any information contact Under Secretary, General Administration Department, Mantralaya, Mumbai before 10.04.2007. (Tel.No.022-22874955 or 22793205).

						              to Government of Maharashtra.

IMMEDIATE						No.TRN-1107/C.R.489/2007/X,
By E-Mail						General Administration Department,
Room No. 642 [Main], Mantralaya,
Madam Kama Road, Mumbai–400 032.
Telephone No. :– 022-2202 3461,
Fax No. :– 022-2287 4955,
Date :- 21.9.2007.
To,

	All IAS Officers of Maharashtra Cadre.


Subject:	Nominations for foreign training during the year-2008. 

Sir / Madam,


	I am directed to inform that the Department of Personnel & Training, vide their letter No. F.37/7/2007-EO(F), dated the 24th August, 2007 has announced about Foreign Training Programme during the year-2008 under Domestic Funding Scheme. A copy of the same is available on official website of the DoPT at http://persmin.nic.in.
If you are interested and are fulfilling all the requirements, kindly send your applications in prescribed format on or before 10th October, 2007 to this Government.  Application received after this date will not be entertained.  You must also apply online directly to Department of Personnel and Training as per the instructions contained in the said letter and indicate having done so to this Department.
					
	Yours faithfully,

									Sd/-												
								   [V.N.More]
						Joint Secretary to Government.

details:
Sub. :-	Selection for the post of Chairperson in the Bihar Electricity Regulatory Commission – Invitation for proposals and nominations – Regarding...

	The Government of Bihar invite proposals and nominations of candidates for consideration of the Selection Committee for post of Chairpersons of the Commission.  The nominee should be persons of ability, integrity and standing having adequate knowledge and experience of, and have shown capacity in dealing with problems relating to engineering, finance, commerce, economics, law or management.
Terms & Conditions :-
[1]	The person appointed would have to resign or opt for voluntary retirement from the service to which he/she belongs,
[2]	The Chairperson would hold office for a term of five years from the date he enters upon his office, but shall not eligible for re-appointment in the same capacity in the commission
Provided that no Chairperson shall hold office as such after he has attained the age of sixty-five years.
[3]	Any member ceasing to hold office as Chairperson shall –
[a]	not accept any commercial employment for a period of two years from the date he ceases to hold office;
[b]	not represent any person before the Central Commission or any State Commission in any manner.
Eligible and interested officers [Pr.Secy. level officers & above] are requested to contact Under Secretary, General Administration Department, Mantralaya, Mumbai immediately. (Tel.No.022-22874955 or 22793205) for further details.
									Sd/-
								Under Secretary
							to Government of Maharashtra.

details:
The Training Division of Department of Personnel and Training has been sponsoring a nine-months Advanced Professional Programme in Public Administration at the Indian Institute of Public Administration, New Delhi every year since 1975-76.  the 34th Programme in the series would be held at the Institute from 1st July 2008 to 31st March 2009.

Eligibility condition :-

	The course is open to officers of All India Services, Central Services (organized and non-organized, technical and non-technical) and State Services, subject to the following eligibility conditions.
(a)	Length of Service	The officer should have put in at least 10 years Group ‘A’ (class-I) service and should be of the rank of Director/Deputy Secretary in the Government of India or holding an equivalent post.  the program is also open for senior officers (Group ‘A’ from State Services.
(b)	Age	The officers should not be more than 50 years on  1-7-2008 (53 years in case of officers belonging to Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe)
(c)	Earlier Training	The officers should not have undergone a training program of 12-weeks or more duration in India during a period of 5 years preceding the date of commencement of this program.  Further the officer should not have undergone a program of training abroad of more than 2 weeks in preceding 2 years, more than one month in the preceding 3 years or more than 6 months in preceding 5 years.

Course Fees :-

	No course fee is payable, but the sponsoring authorities would be required to meet the expenditure on field visit, village study tour, project work and short duration foreign study visit to some neighboring countries.  The expenditure towards the village study, project work, registration fee for M Phil and short duration foreign study visit is expected to be around Rs.1,95,000/- (Rs. One lakh Ninety five thousand only –under revision).  While recommending officers for this programme, the sponsoring authorities must undertake to release the amount to the Indian Institute of Public Administration as soon as intimation in this regard is received from this Department (i.e. Training Division).  The foreign study tour will be subject to the approval fo the competent authority.
	
	Other details is available in Desk-X, General Administration Department, Mantralaya, Mumbai.

	Interested officers are requested contact Under Secretary, General Administration Department, Mantralaya, Mumbai immediately. (Tel.No.022-22874955 or 22793205) for further details.

   Sd/-
Under Secretary to the Government of Maharashtra
title: 34th Advanced Professional Programme in Public Administration  (APPPA)  1st July 2008 to 31st March 2009. (11.01.2008)

details:
The Department of Personnel and Training is requested to nominations of officers for appointments on deputation to posts of Chief Vigilance Officers in Central Public Sector Undertakings during the year 2008.

Eligibility condition :-

	The officers sponsored for Joint Secretary level posts should be at least in the pay scale of Rs. 18400-22400/- and their batches should be empanelled to hold the Joint Secretary/equivalent posts at the center.  The officers to be sponsored for the posts at Director and Deputy Secretary level should be such who have completed 14 years/9 years of service respectively.  In case of Director level officers, they should have been granted the Non Functional Selection Grade in the Cadre.

Terms & Conditions :-
	Terms and conditions of the officers belonging to Group ‘A’ Services appointed as Chief Vigilance Officers in Public Sector Undertakings will be covered by the provisions laid down in our Department’s Circular No.2/29/91-Estt.(Pay.II) dated 5.1.1994 read with 2/8/97-Estt.(Pay-II) dated 9.4.20010.  The details of this circular are also available on this Department’s website.

How to apply :- 

	Regarding the application form for applying for the post of CVO for the year 2008, it has been decided to switch to an on line application form system from this year and the officers are required to apply online in the same application form as the one for the Central Staffing Scheme.  This form is available “on line” on this Departments website (www.persmin.nic.in).
	
	Other details is available in Desk-X, General Administration Department, Mantralaya, Mumbai.

	Interested officers of 1983-1991 Batch are requested to fill their application’s on line & send a copy of this application to Under Secretary, General Administration Department, Mantralaya, Mumbai immediately. (Tel.No.022-22874955 or 22793205) for further details.

   Sd/-
Under Secretary to the Government of Maharashtra

details:
F.No.32/11/2008-EO(MM-II)
GOVERNMENT OF INDIA
DEPARTMENT OF PERSONNEL & TRAINING
OFFICE OF THE ESTABLISHMENT OFFICER
.....
New Delhi, dated the 11th January, 2008

To
	The Chief Secretary,
	Government of Maharashtra,
	Mantralaya,
	Mumbai-32.

Subject:-	Retention of names on offer for Central Deputation under the Central Staffing Scheme for the year 2008.
Sir,
I am directed to refer to the Government of Maharashtra’s Letter No.DEP-1007/C.R.609/2007/X dated 31.12.2007 on the above mentioned subject and to inform that the IAS officers willing to apply for a post on central deputation from the year 2008 onwards are required to submit their personal data “on line”. The proforma is available on the website of this department at http://intraias.inc.in, by opening the above mentioned web site address using Intraias username and password under the heading “on line application for central staffing scheme, 2008”. The Officers after applying on-line, need to take printout of the application form along with the Annexures and submit it to the State Government for onward transmission to the DOPT.  The State Government will then forward the application form to DOPT after verifying it and filling the vigilance clearance/cooling off forms etc.  The officers whose certified particulars will be received from the state governments will only be considered for central deputation.  The Officer concerned have also a choice to opt for any of the three Departments/Ministries for consideration of his/her appointment under Central Staffing Scheme.
2.	It is,therefore,requested to forward the duly certified application forms alongwith all the Annexures of the officers who have applied for central deputation to enable us to consider their appointment for central deputation at the earliest.

Yours faithfully,

sd/-
( Trishaljit Sethi )
Director

   Sd/-
 Under Secretary to the 
Government of Maharashtra
title: Retention of names on offer for Central Deputation under the Central Staffing Scheme for the year 2008. (30.01.2008)

The post of Chairman, Damodar Valley Corporation (DVC) is to be filled by Ministry of Power, New Delhi.  The DVC is a statutory body created under an Act of Parliament and its Chairman, whose office is located in Kolkatta is appointed by the Central Government.

Eligibility Criteria :-

(i)	In respect of IAS officers, those drawing a pay of Rs.22,400/- and above who have held the post of Secretary (Energy), Chairman, SEB or State-level Public Sector Undertakings dealing with Generation/Transmission/ Distribution.
(ii)	In respect of Engineers, officers having 5 years experience in irrigation/power drawing a basic pay of Rs. 22,400/- and above.
(iii)	In respect of officers from the Defence Services, preference will be given to those holding a rank of Major General and above, having experience in Electrical and Mechanical Engineering.
(iv)	In respect of PSUs etc. under the Ministry of Power, engineers having 5 years experience in irrigation/power and drawing basic pay corresponding to Rs.22,400/- (Govt. of India).
(v)	Joint Secretaries/Additional Secretaries, Power, at Government of India level.

details:
GOVERNMENT OF MAHARASHTRA


		No.MIS-1008/CR-17/2008/X,
					General Administration Department,
					Mantralaya, Mumbai – 400 032.
					Date :- 25.2.2008. 

To,
	All IAS Officer
	[Maharashtra Cadre]

Subject :	Cirulation of Civil List 2008.


Dear Sir / Madam,


	I am pleased to inform you that the list of IAS officers of Maharashtra Cadre as on 1st January, 2008 (CIVIL LIST – 2008) is published. The same is available for circulation. Two copies of CIVIL LIST – 2008 [one for personal use & one for office use] will be provided to each officer. 

2.	It has come to our notice that sometimes the copies of the CIVIL LIST get misplaced in transit. Therefore, you are requested to ask your office messenger (deputed to distribute tapal in Mantralaya) to collect 2 copies of Civil List-2008 by giving a formal letter seeking 2 copies of Civil List 2008 over your signature.


						        Yours Sincerely,

details:
The Government of India is required to appoint Director of Census Operations for supervising the census operations in the State/UTs.  Director of Census Operations for Maharashtra State is required to be filled by Selection Grade officers of the IAS in the rank of Director/Deputy Secretary to the Government of India.
The officers appointed to the aforesaid posts shall be entitled to draw Central [Deputation on Tenure] Allowance as provided in Schedule-III-C to the IAS(Pay) Rules, 1954 as amended from time to time.
The duties assigned to the post of Directors of Census Operations include effective supervision, coordination and maintaining good liaison with District Collectors, Head of Departments and Senior Officers of the State Government/Union Territories.  The officers must be of proven ability with adequate district and administrative experience and also be of sound health and physically fit as their work involves extensive touring.

	Eligible and interested officers [1993-1995 Batch] are requested to apply urgently and to contact Under Secretary, General Administration Department, Mantralaya, Mumbai immediately. (Tel.No.022-22874955 or 22793205) for further details.

(a)(i)	holding analogous post on regular basis in the parent cadre or department; or
(ii)	with 2 years’ service in the grade rendered after appointment thereto on regular basis in posts in the scale of pay of Rs. 16400-20000/- or equivalent in the parent cadre/department; or
(iii)	with 3 years’ service in the grade rendered after appointment thereto on regular basis in posts in the scale of pay of Rs.14300-18300/- or equivalent in the parent cadre/department; and
(b)	Possessing the following educational qualifications and experience-
   Essential –
   (i)	Bachelors’ Degree in Mining Engineering from a recognized University or equivalent; and
(ii)	Fifteen (15) years’ experience in coal mining operation, coal mining planning, monitoring and review of projects relating to coal.
Age -	Maximum age limit for appointment on deputation (including short term contract) shall not be exceeding 56 years as on the closing date of receipt of the applications.

details:
Ministry of Environment & Forests has set up a National Biodiversity Authority (NBA) under Biological Diversity Act, 2002.  Rule 9 of the Biological Diversity Rules, 2004 provides that the NBA shall appoint a full time Secretary to it, whose terms and conditions shall be determined by the Authority by regulations.  As per the Recrutiment Regulations notified on 30.6.2006, the post of Secretary, NBA (in the pay scale of Rs.18,400-22,400/-) is to be filled up on deputation, failing which by direct recruitment.  For deputation, officers of the Central or State Governments holding analogous posts on regular basis, or holding posts in the pay scale of Rs.16,400-20,000 or equivalent in the parent cadre/department on regular basis for at least two years, or holding posts in the scale of pay of Rs.14,300-400-18,300 or equivalent in the parent cadre/department for at least four years; and having experience in thethe relevant field as well as in the administration may apply.  The maximum age limit for deputation shall not be exceeding 56 years.
	Eligible and interested officers are requested to apply urgently and to contact Under Secretary, General Administration Department, Mantralaya, Mumbai immediately. (Tel.No.022-22874955 or 22793205) for further details.

   Sd/-
 Under Secretary to the
Government of Maharashtra

details:
Chairperson and five posts of Members in the Competition Commission of India (CCI) are proposed to be filled by direct recruitment.  Applications are hereby invited for filling up of these posts.
2.	The Competition Act, 2002 provides that the Chairperson / Member of the CCI shall be a person fo ability, integrity and standing and who has special knowledge of, and such professional experience of not less than fifteen years in, international trade, economics, business, commerce, law, finance, accountancy, management, industry, public affairs or competition matter, including competition law and policy, which in the opinion of the Central Government, may be useful to the Commission.
3.	Keeping in view the role and importance of CCI as a regulator it is desirable that the applications from the persons with high integrity, eminence and reputation with requisite experience are forwarded for consideration.
4.	The terms and conditions of the service of Chairperson and Members of CCI will be regulated by the Competition Commission of India (Salary, allowances and other Terms and Conditions fo Service of Chairperson and other Members) Rules, 2003.  The Chairperson and Members shall hold office for a term of five years and shall not hold office beyond 65 years of age.  The Chairperson and Members will draw pay in Government of India’s pay scale of Rs.26,000 fixed, in addition to allowances as admissible, subject any revision which may be decided before the date of offer of appointment.
Detils are available on folloing website :-
http://www.mca.gov.in/MinistryWebsite/dca/latestnews/Advertiesment_14may2008.pdf
	Eligible and interested officers [1970-1982 Batch] are requested to apply urgently and to contact Under Secretary, General Administration Department, Mantralaya, Mumbai immediately. (Tel.No.022-22874955 or 22793205) for further details. Last date of reaching applications to New Delhi is 16.06.2008.
   Sd/-
 Under Secretary to the
Government of Maharashtra

details:
Rural Electrification Corporatin [REC] is a premier financial institution engaged in the business of financing power projects in the field of generation, transmission and distribution.  The company has achieved sanctions of Rs.60764 crore, disbursement of Rs.16303 crore.  Profit before tax of Rs. 1315 crore and Net profit of Rs. 862 crore for the financial year 2007-08.  As a recognition f its contribution to the national cause, REC been conferred with the “Navratna” status by the Government of India.  Additionally, Government of India has appointed REC as the nodal agency for implementation of Rajiv Gandhi Grameen Vidyutikaran Yojana [RGGVY], a national programme for providing last mile electrical connectivity to rural households.
2.	REC is interested in inducting an officer, on deputation, from Indian Administrative Servies for appointment to the positin of Executive Director in the IDA pay scale of Rs. 23750- Rs.28550 [Provisional].  The officers should have minimium experience of 16 years, with at least 5 years in the selection grade of Rs. 14,300-400-18300 or in Senior Administrative Grade or Super Time Scale [Rs. 18,400-500-22,400]
.


   Sd/-

Government of Maharashtra

1.	Officers of IAS with 9 years service;
OR

(a) (i)	Holding analogous posts:
(ii)	With five years service in posts in the scale of pay of Rs. 10000-325-15200 or equivalent; and

details:
Subject :-	Filling the vacancy of Registrar & Director (Admn.), NIRD.

	The NIRD intends to do the recruitment for this post from amongh the IAS officers with atleast 14 years of service, who have held previsous assignments in rural development such as Chief Executive Officer, ZP/District development officer/Project Director, DRDA; Collectors and District magistrate etc.  Officers drawing pay in the Selection Grade of the IAS will be eligible.  Marginal relaxation to te eligible conditions may be made in case of deservicng candidates.
2.	Broadly the duties and responsibilities attached to the post of the Registrar and Director (Admn.) in the Institutte are as below :
(a)	The Registrar & Director (Admn.) ia in-cahrge of the Administration Branch of the Institute and responsible for general administration and assistance to the Director General in dealing with administrative matters/administrative arrangements for seminars, conferences, training progammes, study tour etc.
(b)	He shall assist the Director General in matters pertaining to the Executive Council, the General Cojncil, and other Standing Committees.
(c)	He is responsible for the maintenance and deployment of the Institutes vehicles, procurement of stores etc.
(d)	He is controlling officer and Disciplining Authority for certain categories of staff.
(e)	He is also Warden fo the Guest Houses in the Institute.
(f)	He is the Welfare Officer of the Campus.
(g)	He is declared a Faculty Member in terms of DOPT OM No. 12017/2/86-Trg. Dated 31.3.1987.  He is required to take part ikn the academic activities of the Institute.  He is entitled to 15% of basic pay as training allowance (likely to go up to 30% after the Pay Commission’s recommendations).
Eligible [1994-1996 batches] and interested officers are requested to contact Under Secretary, General Administration Department, Mantralaya, Mumbai immediately. (Tel.No.022-22874955 or 22793205) for further details. Last date of application 31.10.2008.

   Sd/-
 Under Secretary to the
Government of Maharashtra
title: Filling the vacancy of Registrar & Director (Admn.), NIRD. (23.09.2008)

details:
Subject:-	Golden Jubilee of the Academy – Publication of a Commemorative Volume.

The Lal Bahadur Shastri National Academy of Administration, Mussoorie will complete 50 years of service to the nation in 2009. On this occasion, we intend to bring out a commemorative volume highlighting the life and times of its alumni.

The Academy seek your help in getting written contributions from serving / retired officers of the All India Services were trained at the Academy. These contributions can be in the form of articles, memoirs, photographs and so on. Even copies of memos or orders would be welcome. The volume will have five parts, each depicting one of the decades since 1958. The contributions should be sent to Academy in soft and hard copy so as to reach us by 26th January, 2009. 

All IAS officers are requested to contact to Shri Ashish Vachhani, Deputy Director at the Academy in this regard. His e-mail id is ashishvachhani@lbsnaa.ernet.in
.


   Sd/-
 Under Secretary to the 
                   			Government of Maharashtra
title: Golden Jubilee of the LBSNAA Academy  Publication of a Commemorative Volume (22.12.2008).

details:
CABINET SECRETARY
										NEW DELHI

K.M. CHANDRASEKHAR

D.O. NO. 171/2/3/2007-Cab.III		New Delhi, the 13th January, 2009


Dear Chief Secretary,



	It has come to the notice of the Central Government that some State Government Officials have participated in international conferences/ video conferences on the issue of Climate Change.  The issue is being debated at various international conferences, one of the most important issues on the global agenda with major international negotiations underway.  Taking into account the importance of this issue, it is imperative that the approach by our Government should be uniform at various international for a.

	I would, therefore, request that it should be ensured that any participation in international conferences including video conferences from State Government should be on the basis of prior political clearance from the Ministry of External Affairs, Government of India.  In addition, taking into account the sensitivity of the issue of Climate Change, the discussions in this regard with foreigners be conducted on the basis of briefs which will be made available by the Ministry of External Affairs.  

	With regards,



									Yours sincerely,

									Sd/-

									(K.N. Chandrasekhar)
title: Cabinet Secretaries letter regarding AIS Officers expressing views on Climate Change.

details:
From :
						V. N. More,
						Joint Secretary, 
						General Administration Department,
						Mantralaya, Mumbai-400 032.
						3rd February, 2009

To,


All IAS Officers of Maharashtra Cadre (who are working with the cadre & are above 40 years of age).


Sub : Annual Health Check-up – Last date 15th February, 2009


Dear Sir/ Madam,


	As you are aware, every member of IAS above 40 years of age is required to undergo annual health check-up as per the provisions of AIS (PAR) Rules, 2007. The summary of the health check-up is to be attached to the Performance Appraisal Report (PAR) of the officer.  Like last year,  this year also, the State Government has issued GR dated 23rd December, 2008 in this regard specifying  the Division-wise hospitals at which the officers are supposed to undergo health check-up as indicated below :
			

1	Officer working in Division :- Mumbai/Konkan Division:-  Mumbai, Mumbai BSD, Thane, Raigad, Ratnagiri, Sindhudurg.

Name of the Hospital:- Bombay Hospital & Medical Research Centre, 12, Marine Lines, 
Mumbai – 400 020.
	
Contact person and phone nos.:- Dr. R.V.Patil, Joint Medical DirectorHos - 022-22082486.

Fees to be paid (in Rs.):- 4,125/-.

2	Officer working in Division :- Pune Division:-  Sangli, Satara, Pune, Kolhapur, Solapur.

Name of the Hospital:-	Jahangir Hospital & Medical Centre, 32, Sasoon Road,Pune-411001.

Contact person and phone nos.:-	Shri.Sainath Pradhan, DGM, MarketingMob – 9890971066Hos.020-26122551 ext. 5026 Health Check Deptt.020-26050550 ext.4006.

Fees to be paid (in Rs.):- 3,500/-

3	Officer working in Division :- Nagpur Division :-   Nagpur, Bhandara, Chandrapur, Gondia, Gadchiroli. 

Name of the Hospital:-	Wardha	Suretech (Old Apollo) Hospital & Research Centre,13-A, Banerjee Marg, Dhantoli,Nagpur-440012.	

Contact person and phone nos.:- Dr. Hema Dhombale,AdministratorMob – 9890188853Hos- 0712-6636800/01.
	
Fees to be paid (in Rs.):- 3,530/-.

4	Officer working in Division :- Nashik Division:- Nashik, Dhule, Jalgaon, Nandurbar, Ahmednagar.	

Name of the Hospital:- Suyash Medical Foundation Pvt.Ltd., Suyash Hospital, Ahilyabai Holkar Marg, Near Mahamarg Bus Stand, Mumbai Naka, Nashik.	

Contact person and phone nos.:- Dr. Hemant Osatwal, Managing DirectorMob – 9422258777Hos- 0253-2318990/1/3.

Fees to be paid (in Rs.):- 3,000/-.

5	Officer working in Division :- Amravati Division:- Amravati, Yavatmal, Akola, Buldhana, Washim.

Name of the Hospital:- Hi-tech Critical Care & Bonde Hospital,Rajapeth, Amravati.	

Contact person and phone nos.:-  Dr. Anil Bonde, Manager Mob-9422156336Dr.Abhijit Deshmukh, Director Mob- 9823070847Hos- 0721-2676416        0721-2566874.

Fees to be paid (in Rs.):- 4,500/-.

6	Officer working in Division :- Aurangabad Division:- Aurangabad, Beed, Jalna, Parbhani, Nanded, Hingoli, Latur, Osmanabad.

Name of the Hospital:- Dr. Hedgevar Hospital,Gajanan Mandir,Garkheda, Aurangabad-431005.	

Contact person and phone nos.:-  Shri. M. S. Dharmadhikari,Administrative Officer,Mob- 9822435516 Hos- 0240-2331195 0240-2321239.

Fees to be paid (in Rs.):-3,350/-.


	All the officers are already informed by letter about the health check-up and time limit of 15th Feb. 2009.  Since only two weeks are remaining, you are requested to contact the concerned hospital at the earliest and complete your health check-up by paying fixed fee to the hospital, get receipt for it and get the fees reimbursed from your office.  The annual health check-up report alongwith its summary should be sent to GAD positively by 20th February, 2009.  All the prescribed tests mentioned in Annexure ‘B’ to the GR dated 23rd December, 2008 are to be conducted on the same day under one roof by the designated hospital (the hospitals are separately provided with the proforma of health check-up).  You may contact the liaison officer/contact person of the hospitals indicated above in advance, fix an appointment for the health check-up, get information on the preparation/ precautions required for the health check-up, intimate your immediate superior about the date on which you are leaving the headquarter for the health check-up (if applicable).  Normal TA/DA rules are applicable.  The time spent for health check-up is treated as duty period.  

	The last date (15th February, 2009) for health check-up will not be extended.  Hence it is reminded and requested to complete the health check-up in time.
	The officers below 40 year of age as on 31.3.2008 may ignore this reminder / e-mail.
									        Sd/-
									(V. N. More)
									Joint Secretary
title: Annual Health Checkup - for officers of 40 years and above - Last Date 15.2.2009

Subject :-	Recruitment to the post of Secretary in the Central Adoption Resource Agency [CARA] – on autonomous body under the Ministry of Women and Child Development, Government of India.

Fill the post of Secretary, Central Adoption Resource Agency [CARA] – an autonomous body of this Ministry.  The post is in the pay scale of Rs.14,300-400-18,300/-[pre-revised].[Revised Rs.37,400-67,000/- with grade pay of Rs.8,700/-]

     The Candidate should display disposition to work in child protection measures, women and child labour, welfare and development of children, empowerment of socially disadvantaged and family welfare and be willing to travel extensively within the country.  He/she should also have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, and show an understanding of various national and international laws and conventions regarding child welfare and rights.  A lump sum amount would be payable to the contract appointee as approved by the Government of India.

   Eligibility :-	with five years regular service in the pay scale of Rs.12000-375-16500/- [pre-revised] [Revised Rs.15600-31100/- with grade pay of Rs.7600]

   Eligible and interested officers [1996-1999 Batch] are requested to contact Under Secretary, General Administration Department, Mantralaya, Mumbai immediately. (Tel.No.022-22874955 or 22793205) for further details.


   Sd/-
 Under Secretary to the
Government of Maharashtra

To,

Subject :	Cirulation of Civil List 2009.

Dear Sir / Madam,

	I am pleased to inform you that the list of IAS officers of Maharashtra Cadre as on 1st January, 2009 (CIVIL LIST – 2009) is printed, and is now available for circulation. Two copies of CIVIL LIST – 2009 [one for personal use & one for office use] will be provided to each officer. 

2.	It has come to our notice that sometimes the copies of the CIVIL LIST get misplaced in transit. details:
No. 1(1)/2009-E-II (B)
Government of India
                                Ministry of Finance
          		               Department of Expenditure
                      	                     ******
New Delhi, the 13th  March, 2009

                             OFFICE MEMORANDUM

    Subject : Payment of Dearness Allowance 
              to CentralGovernmentemployees
               – Revised  Rates effective from 
               1.1.2009

	The undersigned is directed to refer to this Ministry’s office Memorandum No. 1 (3)/2008 –E-II (B) dated 29th August, 2008 on the subject mentioned above and to state that the President  is pleased to decide that the Dearness Allowance payable to Central Government employees shall be enhanced from the existing rate of 16% to 22% with effect from 1st January, 2009.

2.	The provisions contained in paras 3,4 and 5 of this Ministry’s O.M. No. 1 (3)/2008 –E-II (B) dated 29th August, 2008 shall continue to be applicable while regulating Dearness Allowance under these orders. 

3.	 The additional installment of Dearness Allowance payable under these orders shall be paid in cash to all Central Government employees.

4.	  The payment of arrears of Dearness Allowance for the months of January and February, 2009 shall not be made before the date of disbursement  of salary of March, 2009.

5.	These orders shall also apply to the civilian employees paid from the Defence Services Estimates and the expenditure will be chargeable to the relevant head of the Defence Services Estimates.  In regard to Armed Forces personnel and Railway employees separate orders will be issued by the Ministry of Defence and Ministry of Railways, respectively.

6.	In so far as the persons serving in the Indian Audit and Accounts Department are concerned these orders issue after consultation with the Comptroller and Auditor General of India.
 
Sd/-
(R.Prem Anand)
Under Secretary to the Government of India

To,
     All Ministries/Departments of the Government of India as per standard distribution list etc.
     Copy (with usual number of spare copies)  to C & AG,UPSC etc. as per standard  list.
title: Payment of Dearness Allowance to Central Government -- Revised Rates Effective from 01.01.2009

details:
Subject :-	Nominations for appointment to the position of Member, West Bengal Electricity Regulatory Commission.

The Department of Power & Non-Conventional Energy Sources, Government of West Bangal has invited the names of willing and suitable persons for appointment to the above mentioned post. 

Qualifications:- Under the provisions of the Electricity Act, 2003 a Member of the Commission shall be a person of ability, integrity and standing who has adequate knowledge of the Act and has shown capacity in dealings with problems relating to engineering, finance, commerce, economics, law or management.

Duration & Terms:-	The Member shall hold the post for a term of 5(five) years from the date he/she joins the officer or till he/she attaint the age of 65 years, whichever is earlier.  Further, the Member shall not hold any other office during this period.

Pay & Allowances:-		The Member is entitled to get a fixed pay as available to Principle Secretary, Government of West Bengal plus Special Allowance of Rupees One thousand only per month and other allowances as per rules. 

Eligible and interested officers are requested to contact Under Secretary, General Administration Department, Mantralaya, Mumbai immediately. (Tel.No.022-22874955 or 22793205) for further details.

   Sd/-
 Under Secretary to the
Government of Maharashtra
title: Nominations for appointment to the position of Member, West Bengal Electricity Regulatory Commission.

details:
Subject :-	Filling up of the post of Chairperson, Interim Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA) on deputation/contract basis.

The Department of Financial Services is proposed to filled up the post of Chairperson, PFRDA on deputation basis / direct recruitment on contract basis.  Applicatins are invited for illing up this post in the pay scale of Rs. 3,00,000/- (fixed) [without House and Car] The above mention posts as per details below:- 
1]	TENURE :-
The Chairperson and every Member shall hold office for a period of five years from the date on which he enters upon his office and shall be eligible for reappointment :
Provided that no person shall hold office as the Chairperson after he has attined the age of sixty-five years;
Provided further that no person shall hold office as a whole-time member after he has attained the age of sixty-two years.

2]	ELIGIBILITY FOR REEMPLOYMENT :- 
Chairperson or a Member would not be eligible for eemployment under the Central Government or any body/authority substantially financed by the Central Government unless he has cooled off fdor a period of two years.  Similarly, for two years no Chairperson or member would be eligible to take up private employment after demitting office, in the organizations/conglomerates/associates that fell within the operational jurisdiction of the concerned Regulatory Authority.  A full time member will severe all connections from the regulated entities.  Both ful time and part time members wil declare particulars of employment and shareholding in regulated entity of the immediatefamily members i.e. spouse, dependent children and parents. 

3]	PAY :-

A Government servant, if appointed a Chairman, shall receive pay as admissible to the Secretary to the Government of India or such higher pay as decided by the Government.  The pay will be fixed in accordance with the prevailing orders on the subject.  An offical of Public Sector Undertaking (PSU).  A person from a private sector, if appointed as a Chairman, shall draw the pay as decided by the Government.  A government official, if selected as Whole-time member, shall receive pay as admissible to the Additional Secretary to the Government of India.  An official of Public Sector Undertaking (PSU), if selected as Wole-time member, shall draw the last drawn pay in the PSU.  A Person from a private sector, if slected as a Whole-time member, shall draw the pay as decided by the Government.  A part-time member will be entitled to a sitting fee to be decided by the Government.

Eligible and interested officers are requested to contact Under Secretary, General Administration Department, Mantralaya, Mumbai immediately. (Tel.No.022-22874955 or 22793205) for further details.
   Sd/-
 Under Secretary to the
Government of Maharashtra
title: Filling up of the post of Chairperson, Interim Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA) on deputation/contract basis.

Willingness for the Central Deputation in the Year-2011.

	Department of Personnel & Training, New Delhi has invited nominations of officers of the Indian Administrative Service for appointment to posts of Joint Secretary / Director and Deputy Secretary on Central Deputation during the year 2011.
	The D.O.letter No.32/2010-EO(MM.II), dated 01.12.2010 from Establishment Officer to the DoPT & detailed guidelines are displayed by DoPT on their website.

Interested officers of 1982-2001 Batches are requested to apply on line as per their seniority [ 1982-1991 (JS-Level) 1992-1996 (Director -Level), 1997-2001 (Deputy Secy.-Level) ] and send their application alongwith  Bio-Data to Joint Secretary, General Administration Department, Mantralaya, Mumbai immediately (by 10.01.2010).

details:
Subject :-	37th Advanced Professional Programme in Public Administration – (APPPA) – 1st July 2011 to 31st March 2012.


	The Training Division of Department of Personnel and Training has been sponsoring a nine-months Advanced Professional Programme in Public Administration at the Indian Institute of Public Administration, New Delhi every year since 1975-76.  The 37th Programme in the series would be held at the Institute from 1st July 2011 to 31st March 2011.

Eligibility condition :-

	The course is open to officers of All India Services, Central Services (organized and non-organized, technical and non-technical) and State Services, subject to the following eligibility conditions.

(a)	Length of Service	The officer should have put in at least 10 years Group ‘A’ (class-I) service and should be of the rank of Director/Deputy Secretary in the Government of India or holding an equivalent post.  The programme is also open for senior officers (Group ‘A’) from State Services.
(b)	Age	The officers should not be more than 50 years on  1-7-2011 (53 years in case of officers belonging to Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe)
(c)	Earlier Training	The officers should not have undergone a training programme of 12-weeks or more duration in India during a period of 5 years preceding the date of commencement of this programme.  Further the officer should not have undergone a programme of training abroad of more than 2 weeks in preceding 2 years, more than one month in the preceding 3 years or more than 6 months in preceding 5 years.

 
Course Fees :-

	No course fee is payable, but the sponsoring authorities would be required to meet the expenditure on field visit, village study tour, project work and short duration foreign study visit.  The expenditure towards the village study, project work, registration fee for M Phil and short duration foreign study visit is expected to be around Rs.3,38,000/- (Rs. Three lakh Thirty Eight thousand only).  While recommending officers for this programme, the sponsoring authorities must undertake to release the amount to the Indian Institute of Public Administration as soon as intimation in this regard is received from this Department (i.e. Training Division).  The foreign study tour will be subject to the approval fo the competent authority.
	
	Other details is available in Desk-X, General Administration Department, Mantralaya, Mumbai.

	Interested officers are requested contact Under Secretary, General Administration Department, Mantralaya, Mumbai immediately. (Tel.No.022-22874955 or 22793205) for further details.

Sd/-
Under Secretary to the Government of      
Maharashtra
title: 37th Advanced Professional Programme in Public Administration  APPPA  1st July 2011 to 31st March 2012.
